greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = nonnegative value y such that (A155135(n), y) is a solution to the Diophantine equation x^3+28*x^2 = y^2.
comment: Agrees with A155138 except for insertion of zero after a(6) = 15.
program: (MAGMA) [ Integers()!SquareRoot(a) : n in [ -30..1500] | IsSquare(a) where a is n^3+28*n^2 ];
results.author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jan 21 2009
